title: deadsea33
author: deadsea33
content: hugeblack He says I hacked or bought this account. He also said that many posts have been deleted, suddenly merit distribution has been started.Let's begin.I registered in this forum in 4/25/2013 . I was regularly active in this forum till 2018. After that suddenly due to family and personal problems I could not active in the forum like before.Then after becoming active once in 1/3/2021, I thought I will be active regularly from now on, so I changed the password once. My luck was bad then, again I had to fight for my family. Then I thought that after becoming active, I will start from zero. Moreover, many of my posts were of poor quality. So I deleted almost all my posts.Also, a forum member can delete his own post, this is not an anti-forum act. So anyone can do this.I forgot the password so i 6/17/2023 date reset the password through email. Then I use new email and strong password to strengthen security.I don't see anything wrong in doing this for the security of my account. Hope you understand.And Starting a word game for all forum members especially new members to gain knowledge and share good things about the forum, it ended on 3rd July. I think merit doesn't matter, they all can learn a lot from it. hugeblack mate , please respond.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I check your profile, it's really suspicious you changed your password, email and suddenly woke up. You were known as altcoins developer way back and there are four users trust you. QuoteThis user's password was reset recently.This user's email address was changed recently.This user recently woke up from a long period of inactivity.I search on ninjastic.space but I can't find your old address. This mean there's no way to prove if you're the real owner, all you said above only words which can't be verified. I think you must be thankfully to hugeblack since he only give you a neutral tag, now you create this thread and make people looking into your account. I wouldn't be surprised if you will get negative tag.

comments.author: deadsea33
comments.body: Quote from: Jawhead999 on July 08, 2023, 03:43:38 PMI check your profile, it's really suspicious you changed your password, email and suddenly woke up. You were known as altcoins developer way back and there are four users trust you. All your questions have already been All your questions have already been answered by me, you should read the whole post carefully and you will get the answer.woke up - after being inactive for a long time, then active, it will automatically write woke up, it is normal.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Can you sign an old bitcoin address or altcoin address that you posted on the forum long ago? It will vanish the doubt and I think no one will then think of leaving you any feedback.QuoteLooks like this account has been hacked/bought, deleted a lot of posts, suddenly starts distributing merits, and may have several alternatives in his trust history. While I do agree with the none bolded parts but I really don't like the bold parts especially when a feedback was written as a personal note. Looks like - if you are not sure then why you go openly and start judging someone? You could be wrong and if you are wrong then you are effecting the said person and giving him a bad experience of the forum.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote Moreover, many of my posts were of poor quality. So I deleted almost all my posts.Forgive , OP, but your merit history suggests that someone really liked your posts; otherwise, why would he give you 20 or more merit merits per post? Why did you remove these unique posts that society might also appreciate?But something else is also interesting: this donor has a very bad reputation on the forum. I think that everything is interconnected. And hugeblack's suspicions have some basis.https://bpip.org/smerit.aspx?to=deadsea33&from=Vlad2Vlad

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: deadsea33 on July 08, 2023, 03:30:22 PMhugeblack He says I hacked or bought this account. He also said that many posts have been deleted, suddenly merit distribution has been started.Whatever reason you state, the activity you are carrying out is suspicious, be it the merits you are distributing, deleting your own posts, your activities and so on, but @hugeblack's suspicion, against you is a natural thing, considering the activity you are doing, the account was bought or hacked.Maybe you should convince @hugeblack, in this case, whatever he asks or reasonable proof, that's the best way.Â However, I noticed elsewhere that there is something strange about the Merit you are giving these two users.1. Rbolisna2. Honey$11I saw both of their transactions, whether it's your Alt or something else, my assumption is for the OP, you have a low ranked Alt, by buying a high rated account and have quite a lot of sMerit reserves, you easily distribute to your lower ranked Alts to go to the next level.Example: the evidence that I got and I saw, against the two accounts below.Proof:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x466979990fc4c451c51f484a8622293a44a56f7fcc667688627d0ac6748e4219Quote from: Rbolisna on January 22, 2023, 10:51:47 AMForum Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3515042 BSC Wallet Address: 0xdc8dEb9286dA8faaE67f8C9469cB930685AdCB3d[ Archive ]Quote from: Madu$11 on June 27, 2023, 11:32:10 PMForum Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3462377 BSC Wallet Address: 0x31cD13A31E9bbb21cC9F1244bBD532D91Edd24d7[ Archive ]Proof:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=merit;u=3515042https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=merit;u=3462377The two addresses above are related to the two accounts above, I'm sure if you don't delete your post, maybe more evidence can be found, who are you, the real or fake owner.But if I dive deeper into the investigation, I can find the accounts you distribute Merit ranked Jr. members, connected to each other.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: deadsea33 on July 08, 2023, 03:30:22 PMhugeblack He says I hacked or bought this account. He also said that many posts have been deleted, suddenly merit distribution has been started.Have you checked all the allegations laid on you and found them to be untrue? They are definitely what has transpired between you and the account, i expect you to make this thread assuming none of these were found to be true, so why are you so nervous about having a feedback which you deserve base on what has happened, it's what was done on your account but you don't want to accept that fact.Quote from: deadsea33 on July 08, 2023, 03:30:22 PMThen after becoming active once in 1/3/2021, I thought I will be active regularly from now on, so I changed the password once. My luck was bad then, again I had to fight for my family. Then I thought that after becoming active, I will start from zero. Moreover, many of my posts were of poor quality. So I deleted almost all my posts.This is what exactly happens when a user account is found to have change of hands, why do you have to delete all the post if truly you're the owner of the account right from the start, why change in password, everything that has transpired is already talking directly towards the review left on you, no reasonable person will want to tarnish his quality contributions he has built over year on his profile and deleted everything at once.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 08, 2023, 04:00:42 PMCan you sign an old bitcoin address or altcoin address that you posted on the forum long ago? It will vanish the doubt and I think no one will then think of leaving you any feedback.[...]That'll probably be a bit problematic, I can't find OP posted any address in the past other than the one he made this week enrolling on several campaigns and seems completely new.The merit history, though, provided something that's quite interesting and worth scrutinizing, thanks lovesmayfamilis for that. For example, though Ninjastic and Loyce's archiever didn't perfectly cover that far in the past, so I have to take a ballpark, this merit is likely belongs to this post in the cluster, While these two belongs to a well archived one, Quote from: https://ninjastic.space/post/52658129I just wanted to say goodbye to this community.I have no more any kind of personal participation in ixcoin.Or maybe I was wrong, after all, I am not that talented on digging evidences from the past, there are far better members on this field. But, I don't think it mattered much. One thing that caught my eyes is that OP said this,Quote from: deadsea33 on July 08, 2023, 03:30:22 PM[...]I registered in this forum in 4/25/2013 . I was regularly active in this forum till 2018. After that suddenly due to family and personal problems I could not active in the forum like before.Then after becoming active once in 1/3/2021, I thought I will be active regularly from now on, so I changed the password once. My luck was bad then, again I had to fight for my family. Then I thought that after becoming active, I will start from zero. Moreover, many of my posts were of poor quality. So I deleted almost all my posts.[...]I forgot the password so i 6/17/2023 date reset the password through email. Then I use new email and strong password to strengthen security.[...]BPIP data said this, which correspond with the dates above,One interesting thing I found from the archived post was that OP is active on ixcoin as a treasurer in 2019. I thought you're too busy for family and personal problem, OP? And how exactly being a treasurer for a project can be considered as a poor quality that you deleted all of the post related to ixcoin? Can you please explain these?

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: I have one simple questionWhat was your relationship with IXcoin project? Were you the owner/developer?I need to know if i can trust you or give you a benefit of doubt. Don't even try to lie. It won't help.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on July 08, 2023, 06:09:18 PMI have one simple questionWhat was your relationship with IXcoin project? Were you the owner/developer?I need to know if i can trust you or give you a benefit of doubt. Don't even try to lie. It won't help. [Former] treasurer, as stated and deleted on this archived post, not sure if he mean he's the CFO or simply the one holding all the funds. He's still a part of a team and active in 2019, though. And the way I understood from his timeline explanation, he had to take hiatus from 2018-2023, pseudo-awake in 2021, due to family issue.

comments.author: CryptoHFs
comments.body: @Vlad2Vlad can confirm whether it's the real owner or not.

After that suddenly due to family and personal problems I could not active in the forum like before.<...>While your family and personal problems may explain your lack of activity on the forum, they cannot explain the drastic deterioration in your English language proficiency. What happened to your literacy skills? And why did you delete most of your old forum posts?

He's still a part of a team and active in 2019, though. A Chief Financial Officer/Treasurer... WowThen i guess he shouldn't have a problem signing a message from any of the following donation bitcoin addresses that appeared on his profile at one point as per the archivesQuote from: https://web.archive.org/web/20170919233322/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=106374Donations for iXcoin development: BTC: 17ckvmvSt8SPEy2DnjtGVpY8p5KK5B9f3cQuote from: https://web.archive.org/web/20160127195053/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=106374Donations for iXcoin development: BTC: 1BdftzcoqrR6sAHRMTZoFcUnDvJDRgcZBPProve to us that you are the original account owner Â @deadsea33 or the thread you just opened in protest to a mere neutral tag is just going to open more cans of worms.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 08, 2023, 04:00:42 PMWhile I do agree with the none bolded parts but I really don't like the bold parts especially when a feedback was written as a personal note. Looks like - if you are not sure then why you go openly and start judging someone? You could be wrong and if you are wrong then you are effecting the said person and giving him a bad experience of the forum. I have two reasons for this:1) I've been trying to push him to create high quality posts, if he does and after about 2 weeks we'll have a good track posting record from which we can assess whether this account has been hacked or not.2) He joined a signature campaign, and I was afraid that he would ask for a loan with the guarantee of that campaign payment, and I do not have enough proof, especially with @deadsea33 deleting all his previous addresses/posts.@BitcoinGirl.Club, Aren't these reasons enough to give "neutral tag"?Quote from: JeromeTash on July 08, 2023, 08:26:47 PMThen i guess he shouldn't have a problem signing a message from any of the following donation bitcoin addresses that appeared on his profile at one point as per the archivesNow I'm surprised, @OP was careful to hide any data from his past.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Some suspicions about your account just happened - maybe after this thread create: Can activity back to 0?@PytagoraZ seems to have another trick to draw attention to your account instead of throwing mud at the wall. He's even obscured your username to avoid conflict - but apparently he has other ways of exposing you. Oh no - I also have my suspicions about your activity, this has raised questions in my brain as to why you deleted so many of those posts.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHFs on July 08, 2023, 06:32:43 PM@Vlad2Vlad can confirm whether it's the real owner or not.How? I don't think Vlad2Vlad would have known if the original owner of the account sold his account and/or got hacked.Quote from: JeromeTash on July 08, 2023, 08:26:47 PM[...]A Chief Financial Officer/Treasurer... WowThen i guess he shouldn't have a problem signing a message from any of the following donation bitcoin addresses that appeared on his profile at one point as per the archives[...]Ok, now that's awesome. I. Am. Impressed. I'll be showering you with way more than 2 merits if you're not on legendary already.Well, OP, I am quite sure hugeblack is reasonable and doesn't have any malicious intent. If you can explain your situation and prove yourself, I think he'll be more than happy to remove the tag.

Upon reviewing its history, I am strongly convinced that you are not the original owner and it seems highly likely that this account was either bought or, even worse, hacked.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: I am notÂ  an expert in account digging but I strongly believe that from above information they passed through your account it shows that this account is hacked or either bought account coupled with the malicious activity of deleting your post and again with merits sharing shows that something is wrong somewhere. There was a post you created and I watch, it was from then I noticed this account was likely bought or changed hand.
